description: You most likely will only encounter CMS profile files if you are a network administrator that sets up a Connection Manager for the purpose of remotely connecting to a network, such as an organizational network protected by a VPN server or an Internet Service Provider ( ISP ). For example, a network administrator at a company may set up an employee with Connection Manager to allow him to access the company network from a remote location.

The network administrator creates a profile with the CMAK application and packages it with other configuration files, such as .CMP and .INF files in an .EXE file. The administrator then distributes the package to a remote user, which allows him to connect to the network.

common_filenames.description: car_[name of your car].cms - The naming convention for CMS files.
